input_text:
Job Title: Senior Agile Project Manager (WorkDay)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description:Position Title: Senior Project Manager with (Workday) Location: (Remote)  Position Title: Senior Agile Project Manager with ( ServiceNow ) Location: ( Hybrid ,VA )  Duration: Fulltime   Candidate must be able to work Eastern Time hours.  Role Summary This role is responsible for initiation, management, and delivery of multiple, high-profile projects for divisions and stakeholders. The Agile Project Management Organization (PMO) within the Office of Data, Security, and Technology (ODST), this person will be working with other Project Managers, Scrum Masters and the Manager, Portfolio in the Agile PMO to ensure the successful prioritization, resourcing, and implementation of multiple ongoing projects in an Agile environment.  ResponsibilitiesWorks closely with Project Managers and Scrum Masters to ensure high-quality project delivery within an established project schedule, scope, and budget.Experience managing a Workday implementation is preferred.Ensures teams deliver according to project plan and schedule.Participates in Agile ceremonies and planning, including stand-up meetings, sprint demos, and retrospectives.Participates and helps facilitate Scrum of Scrums meetings to prioritize and schedule ODST's portfolio of work.Participates in business requirement analysis sessions and contributes to project plan development, including setting critical milestones and allocating delivery resources.Defines project milestones while working with business stakeholders, business partners, PMO staff, and technical managers to build delivery timeline.Supports PMO Management Team in achieving project alignment with strategic priorities and delivery resource availability.Maintains a strategic perspective of business drivers and technology capabilities.Manages project risks and develops mitigation plans to ensure on-time delivery.Acts as the liaison between project delivery teams, management, and business stakeholders while communicating through Scrum Masters and Business Partners.Contributes to monthly, quarterly, and on-demand report from the PMO, for a wide variety of audiences, including senior leadership.Performs vendor/contract management responsibilities, including managing external vendor/contract relationships, coordinating the vendor/contract selection processes, and monitoring vendor/contract performance.
 QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent experience required in Information Technology or a related field.Certified Project Management Professional (PMP), Scrum Master (CSM), Certified Scrum Professional (CSP), Certified Product Owner (CSPO), Certified Executive Coach (CEC), or equivalent professional certification preferred.Minimum of 7+ years of experience with agile practices, patterns, and techniques.Minimum of 7+ years of experience managing information technology projects.Minimum of 7+ years of professional experience in an IT environment.Demonstrated project management experience in an agile environment and ability to work on multiple priorities/projects simultaneously without impact to quality of work.Experience using both traditional waterfall and agile project management methodologies.Demonstrated experience in task management, risk management, and scope management.Ability to communicate about technical matters with business stakeholders and business matters with technical stakeholders.Experience with delivery methodologies in a fast-paced, complex environment – i.e., Scrum, SAFe, Extreme Programming.Experience with project management tools – i.e., MS Project, Atlassian Jira, SharePoint.Must have experience managing vendors/contractors.Must have experience establishing and communicating best practices.Must have experience with budget and cost management, as well as contract/procurement processes.Experience operating in a community of practice model strongly preferred.A self-starter able to administer a number of open, ongoing assignments at any one time, where some assignments are routinely unstructured, requiring autonomy and independent judgment. Ability to clearly articulate a position with sound logic, supporting empirical evidence, and impartiality.Ability to effectively represent the organization to a variety of both internal and external constituencies.Superior verbal and written communication skills.
 Join us in driving innovation, excellence, and success. You will enjoy a competitive salary, flexible work hours, remote work options, health insurance, retirement plan, paid vacation, and more. You will also have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, learn new skills, and collaborate with talented colleagues. Become a part of our forward-thinking team, where your expertise will shape the future of digital transformation. Apply now and let your skills soar to new heights!

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Senior Agile Project Manager
output_json.summary: Responsible for initiation, management, and delivery of multiple, high-profile projects for divisions and stakeholders.
optional_skills: Experience using both traditional waterfall and agile project management methodologies
Experience with delivery methodologies in a fast-paced, complex environment
Experience establishing and communicating best practices
Experience with budget and cost management, as well as contract/procurement processes
Experience operating in a community of practice model
Self-starter ability to administer open, ongoing assignments autonomously
Superior verbal and written communication skills
job_responsibilities: Works closely with Project Managers and Scrum Masters to ensure high-quality project delivery.
Ensures teams deliver according to project plan and schedule.
Participates in Agile ceremonies and planning.
Participates in business requirement analysis sessions.
Supports PMO Management Team in achieving project alignment.
Maintains a strategic perspective of business drivers and technology capabilities.
Manages project risks and develops mitigation plans.
Acts as a liaison between project delivery teams, management, and business stakeholders.
Contributes to reports for various audiences.
output_json.company_information: Join us in driving innovation, excellence, and success. Enjoy a competitive salary, flexible work hours, remote work options, health insurance, retirement plan, paid vacation, and more. Opportunity to work on exciting projects, learn new skills, and collaborate with talented colleagues. Part of a forward-thinking team shaping the future of digital transformation.
